biolockj.module.seq

Class TrimPrimers

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.module.BioModuleImpl
      • biolockj.module.ScriptModuleImpl
        • biolockj.module.JavaModuleImpl
          • biolockj.module.seq.TrimPrimers
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BioModule, JavaModule, ScriptModule

    public class TrimPrimers
extends JavaModuleImpl
implements JavaModule
    This BioModule removes sequence primers from demultiplexed files.
    The primers are defined using regular expressions in a separate file.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static String INPUT_REQUIRE_PRIMER
      Config property "trimPrimers.requirePrimer" is a boolean used to determine if sequences without a primer should be kept or discarded

      Config property "trimPrimers.filePath" defines the file path to the file that defines the primers as regular expressions.

      Metadata column name for column that holds number of trimmed reads per sample: "Num_Trimmed_Reads"

    • Method Detail

      • checkDependencies

        public void checkDependencies()
                       throws Exception
        Validates the file that defines the REGEX primers. If primers are located at start of read, add REGEX line anchor "^" to the start of the primer sequence in "trimPrimers.filePath".
        • If seqs are multiplexed, Demultiplexer must run as a prerequisite module
        • If seqs are paired-end reads, and PearMergeReads is configured before this module, "trimPrimers.filePath" must contain the reverse compliment of the reverse primer with a REGEX line anchor "$" at the end.
        Specified by:
        checkDependencies in interface BioModule
        Overrides:
        checkDependencies in class ScriptModuleImpl
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if missing or invalid dependencies are found

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp()
             throws Exception
        Set "Num_Trimmed_Reads" as the number of reads field.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

      • runModule

        public void runModule()
               throws Exception
        Trims primers from fasta or fastq files. Saves messages for summary email with metrics on best/worst and average files. Just a quick implementation on reporting metrics is working but code needs clean-up and simplification.
        Specified by:
        runModule in interface JavaModule
        Specified by:
        runModule in class JavaModuleImpl
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if any runtime error occurs

      • getPrimers

        protected Set<String> getPrimers(boolean doLog)
                          throws Exception
        Get the primers listed in the "trimPrimers.filePath". If a merged fw primer (starting with ^) and a merged rv primer (ending with $) are found set mergedReadTwoPrimers = true to enforce reads must have both primers if discarding reads without valid primers
        Parameters:
        doLog - Boolean set TRUE to print to log
        Returns:
        Set of primers
        Throws:
        Exception - if unable to read the file
